titles.title: Cell Phone Contraband Act of 2009
Cell Phone Contraband Act of 2010
Cell Phone Contraband Act of 2010
Cell Phone Contraband Act of 2010
Cell Phone Contraband Act of 2010
A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit the possession or use of cell phones and similar wireless devices by Federal prisoners.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

calendar.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Reported by Senator Leahy with amendments. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 269.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
The committee reported amendments were agreed to by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.
Mr. Scott (VA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1749.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.

vote.text: Senate agreed to House amendment by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text as Senate agreed to House amendment

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 8/10/2010--Public Law. Cell Phone Contraband Act of 2010 - Amends the federal criminal code to include a phone or other device provided by a commercial mobile service as a "prohibited object" the provision of which to, or the possession of which by, a federal prisoner is prohibited. Directs the Comptroller General to submit a report to Congress within one year after the enactment of this Act on a study of: (1) telephone rates within federal prisons, to include information on interstate, intrastate, and collect calls made by prisoners; (2) state and federal efforts to prevent the smuggling of cell phones and other wireless devices into prisons; and (3) cell phone use by inmates in selected state and federal prisons. Provides for compliance of the budgetary effects of this Act with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010.
